sn4.7:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrel Sanctuary.
sn4.7:1.2: Then, when the night was fading, the Blessed One, having spent much of the night walking back and forth in the open, washed his feet, entered his dwelling,
sn4.7:1.3: and lay down on his right side in the lion’s posture, with one leg overlapping the other, mindful and clearly comprehending, having attended to the idea of rising.
sn4.7:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and addressed him in verse:
sn4.7:2.1: “What, you sleep? Why do you sleep?
sn4.7:2.2: What’s this, you sleep like a wretch?
sn4.7:2.4: What’s this, you sleep when the sun has risen?”
sn4.7:3.2: Within him craving no longer lurks, to lead him anywhere;
sn4.7:3.3: With the destruction of all acquisitions The Awakened One
sn4.7:3.4: sleeps: Why should this concern you, Māra?”
sn4.7:4.1: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
